newsitem.title: USA: CE Software settles Powercore lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: CE Software settles Powercore lawsuit.

text.p: CE Software Holdings Inc said Wednesday it settled a lawsuit against Powercore Inc filed in February 1996, which alleged defective product and false representation.

In 1994, CE Software purchased intellectual property rights and technology assets from Powercore. The purchase price included 293,750 shares of common stock in CE Software Holdings, 250,000 of which have been in escrow since 1994.
Under the settlement agreement, Powercore will return the 250,000 shares of common stock, CE Software said.
"After weighing the various options, CE Software determined that settling the case out of court is in the best interests of our shareholders," Richard Skeie, president, said in a statement.
CE Software said recovery of stock will result in adjustments of stockholders' equity and intangible assets. The settlement should not otherwise impact financial results, it added.
CE Software develops comprehensive, client/server electronic mail systems.
